about.intro1: I am a 23 year old guy from Inderøy, Norway with a bachelor in digital media & design. This site is meant as a portefolio aswell as a place I can experiment with development and design.
about.intro2: My goal is to get better at front-end development and I have this autumn worked at Prios Kompetanse AS , where i have gotten to know VueJS.
about.bachelorDescription: A bachelor in digitale media and design at HIØ involves an introduction to many of the steps included in development and design of digital applications. Some of the courses I have been trough are web-development, programming, 3D-modelling and graphical design.
about.wordpressDescription:
Until recently I have used Wordpress to publish projects from my course, they are still here:
https://erlendworkblog.wordpress.com
about.erlendwebDescription:
Erlendweb is made with VueJS/Vuetify and hosted on Netlify. The source code for this page is public at:
https://github.com/bronsetn/erlendweb

contact.description: Messages from here are sent to bronsetherlend@gmail.com

projects.title: Webography
projects.description: A smaller website made to show off some interesting design and tricks for typography on the web.
projects.content: I decided on making this page as a smaller personall project because I find typography with CSS to be kinda neat and something I wanted to get better at. I want the page to work as a personal library as well as a place other people can find inspiration or resources for typography on the web.

projects.title: Maribro
projects.description: A website made to show of the art made by Mari Brønseth. The site is made with VueJS and hosted on Netlify. The site consist of a page to present the artist aswell as a image-gallery for many of the artworks she's made.
projects.content: One of the challenges with the development of the site was dealing with such a large number of image files, as it slowed loadingtime for the site. I have tried to improve loading time through implementing Netlify Large Media, which uses uses GIT-LFS (Large file storage) for storing images.

projects.title: Prios Events
projects.subtitle: Project for Prios Kompetanse AS
projects.description: A website meant for job fairs and similar types of events. I worked with the development of the front-end and design of the site for Prios Kompetanse AS. The site is one of my first projects working with VueJS and is still being devolped further at Prios.
projects.content: Through this project I got to work with implimenting one of Prios's systems in to a new website, I also got some insight into the tools and methods used in modern web development. Experience I have made us of when developing erlendweb.

projects.title: Bachelor thesis
projects.subtitle: Augmented reality to show the history of emigration
projects.description: My bachelor thesis for digital media and design at Østfold University College. The purpose for the project was to lay the foundations for an AR-application to strenghten the experience for visitors to Kvam municipality.
projects.content: The task involved developing a AR-application protoype with the possibility of placeing 3D-models through GPS-coordinates. The app was deveolped in Unity and the 3D-models where made with Maya Autodesk. The Ar functionality was achieved through the AR-motor -Vuforia that exist on Android phones and the Unity-extension AR + GPS Location.

projects.title: Erlendworkblog
projects.subtitle: Wordpress blog
projects.description: A website used for publishing some of the projects from my bachelor study.
projects.content: I have tried to carry over many of the design choises and elements from the Wordpress-site to erlendweb.no. Some of the similarities between the site's is the color palette used and some of the graphic elements used -such as the logo.

other.description: Smaller experiments with code and design.
other.nasaDescription: Here i have used one of Nasa's public API's that gives out a new space-related image each day.
other.nasaSources:
For a list of all images published since 2015 visit: https://apod.nasa.gov/apod/archivepix.html
For information about using the API i have used this tutorial: https://blog.jakelee.co.uk/an-introduction-to-the-nasa-apod-api/
other.forecastDescription: This component uses the browsers geolocation to get a forecast for your coordinates. If geolocation is disabled a forecast from Oslo is fetched instead.
other.forecastSources:
To get watherdata Openweathermap's 5 day forecast API is used: https://openweathermap.org/api
To get the city or place name Openstreetmap's API is used: https://www.openstreetmap.org/
